item.title: djokovic, federer win, injury stops clijsters at indian wells
item.description: novak djokovic rolled on at the bnp paribas open, routing ernests gulbis 6-0, 6-1 in the fourth round on tuesday.

item.title: canucks 2, blackhawks 1 (ot): burrows lifts canucks into next round with overtime goal
item.description: alex burrows scored his second goal 5:22 into overtime, helping the vancouver canucks avoid a historic playoff collapse by eliminating the defending champion chicago blackhawks.

item.title: ericsson's cautious outlook takes shine off shares
item.description: ericsson, the world's biggest mobile network equipment maker, gave a cautious outlook on thursday which sent its shares lower even though the firm stuck to sales and profit growth targets for the next three years.

item.title: on father's orders, mother who drove in river buried apart
item.description: a mother who drowned herself and three of her children by intentionally driving her minivan into the hudson river was buried separately from her children on thursday after their father intervened in plans to inter them together.

item.title: facebook slams man who claims ownership
item.description: in a response to paul ceglia's amended federal court complaint, facebook calls him a "scam artist" and his lawsuit a "fraud."

item.title: instead of helping, trustee program is hurting veterans, families say
item.description: lawyers and advocates say a trustee program aimed at protecting veterans and their families from financial loss and abuse is mismanaged, poorly regulated and does more harm than good.

item.title: democrats in indiana end protest and return
item.description: house democrats returned to the indian capitol almost five weeks after they fled the state, arguing they had been successful in softening parts of the republicans' agenda.

item.title: bahrain ends martial law but renews crackdown on protests
item.description: security forces attacked peaceful protesters in more than 20 villages with rubber bullets, stun grenades, shotguns and tear gas, according to human rights observers in bahrain.

item.title: theater review | 'king lear': fantasies aside, life's tough at the top
item.description: derek jacobi helps make michael grandage's production of 'king lear' at the brooklyn academy of music a true entertainment.

item.title: former nurse advised depressed people online about suicide
item.description: a former minnesota nurse who advised depressed people over the internet the best way to tie ropes to hang themselves and encouraged one to webcast the event, was found guilty on tuesday of inciting two suicides.

item.title: china agrees to end domestic wind power subsidies
item.description: china has agreed to stop subsidizing wind power companies that use domestically produced components rather than imports.

item.title: hossa nets a pair as blackhawks beat sharks, 6-3
item.description: marian hossa scored two power-play goals less than 3 minutes apart to ignite a five-goal outburst by chicago in the second period.

item.title: africa: many civilians have been killed in disputed region of sudan
item.description: officials said that 116 civilians, including many children, had been killed last month when the northern sudanese army seized the disputed area of abyei.

item.title: obama promises help to rebuild tornado-hit south
item.description: president barack obama promised federal aid on friday to the tornado-ravaged south, where deadly twisters have killed at least 339 people and caused billions of dollars in damage.

item.title: theater review | 'the intelligent homosexual's guide to capitalism and socialism with a key to the scriptures': debating dialectics and dad's suicide plan
item.description: the long-awaited new play by tony kushner is a densely textured portrait of a brooklyn family losing its (strictly secular) religion.

item.description: the milwaukee bucks maintained their slim playoff chances by completing a 93-87 victory in overtime over the philadelphia 76ers on saturday.

item.description: checking the hearts of teenagers, athletes and non-athletes alike, could save thousands of lives, a new study suggests.

item.description: eight-times major winner tom watson has been selected as the honoree of next year's memorial tournament, organizers said sunday.

item.title: hrw calls for probe over uganda food protest deaths
item.description: human rights watch said on monday ugandan security forces shot dead at least nine unarmed people -- including three in the back as they fled -- during protests against soaring inflation, and called for an independent probe.

item.title: how much do your children sleep?
item.description: many youngsters and most teenagers do not get enough sleep, and this can result in serious consequences, impairing school performance and even raising the risk of depression and other mood disorders.

item.title: europe's muslims voice doubt, anger on bin laden
item.description: europe's muslims expressed anger or disbelief friday over the killing of osama bin laden but praise for the late al qaeda chief was in short supply.

item.description: fighting flared in gaza on thursday after a palestinian anti-tank missile hit an israeli school bus, wounding two, and israeli forces retaliated with planes and artillery, killing five palestinians.

item.title: critics slam study that us priest abuse in the past
item.description: a church-sponsored study on wednesday blamed poorly trained priests and a deviant society for the roman catholic church's sex abuse crisis, but victims dismissed it as a whitewash of an institutional coverup.

item.description: israeli air strikes and shelling killed nine palestinians in the gaza strip friday, with no end in sight to an israeli operation against hamas islamists in retaliation for a rocket attack on an israeli school bus.

item.title: death rate down, life expectancy up in u.s.
item.description: children born today can expect to live longer than ever in u.s. history, according to preliminary government data, released wednesday.
